result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian S Wetzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Felony), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine and costs have been paid in full from cash bond previously posted.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through Petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted if stay is lifted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian S Wetzel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Roy Wetzel, check no. 10538

ADDRESS INFO for Brian S Wetzel
Current: N4018 Lilac Lane, Kewaunee, WI 54216 United States  (Effective: 05-15-2017)
Prior: N3799 CTH N, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

Defendant Brian S Wetzel in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Discussion regarding sentence credit. Bond no longer in effect.
by Roy Wetzel

Defendant Brian S Wetzel in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Defendant Brian S Wetzel in custody. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions status. Defense advises of discussions with ADA Korb, possible pending extradition from Illinois. Discussion regarding offers, which are in flux according to Atty Heyne based on what's going to happen with DOC.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 11:15 am.
by Defendant
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery
Not to leave Door or Kewaunee Counties.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Brian S Wetzel in court, in custody. Attorney Peter Raymond Heyne appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State presents argument for cash bond. Defendant has been back in Wisconsin for 2 weeks, took off from Illinois because they wouldn't give him permission to come and visit ill relatives, did a commitment here, can get a job in a factory with his cousin, requests high signature bond. State presents further argument. Defendant wants to end this today if there was some kind of plea agreement. Defense advises he would need to be here in person.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Peter Raymond Heyne in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of attempts to contact Defendant, has no idea where Defendant is. State advises that Defendant was released from Cook County Jail using a name John Karshna, advises of DOC warrant for absconding from Probation. Review of arrest warrant issued in December. No further scheduling required at this time.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of difficulty dealing with Cook County, which is where Defendant remains with unknown return date. Defense will attempt to contact Defendant's mother to try to get additional information.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is in custody in Cook County Jail via extradition, believes he will be returned here on cash bond when that is completed, does not know when that will be, has contact info for Defendant's mother, requests status in 60 days.  Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is in custody in Cook County, Illinois on extradition case, requests rescheduling, did not have time to investigate Cook County matter.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Status conference set for July 11, 2016 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.
by State

Defendant Brian S Wetzel in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Brian S Wetzel in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant

Defendant Brian S Wetzel in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Brian S Wetzel in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defense in Court. Court reviews previous activity. Underlying sentencing is being served now. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Brian S Wetzel in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant wants to get an attorney. Discussion regarding Defendant's status on probation, underlying sentence. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
